moduleMetadataJson.name: Authentication Capture: SMB
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module provides a SMB service that can be used to capture the
        challenge-response password hashes of SMB client systems. Responses
        sent by this service have by default the configurable challenge string
        (\x11\x22\x33\x44\x55\x66\x77\x88), allowing for easy cracking using
        Cain & Abel, L0phtcrack or John the ripper (with jumbo patch).

        To exploit this, the target system must try to authenticate to this
        module. One way to force an SMB authentication attempt is by embedding
        a UNC path (\\SERVER\SHARE) into a web page or email message. When
        the victim views the web page or email, their system will
        automatically connect to the server specified in the UNC share (the IP
        address of the system running this module) and attempt to
        authenticate. Another option is using auxiliary/spoof/{nbns,llmnr} to
        respond to queries for names the victim is already looking for.
author: hdm <x@hdm.io>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SRVHOST
options.description: The local host or network interface to listen on. This must be an address on the local machine or 0.0.0.0 to listen on all addresses.

options.name: SRVPORT
options.description: The local port to listen on.

options.name: ListenerComm
options.description: The specific communication channel to use for this service

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher spec - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: SMBServerMaximumBuffer
options.description: The maximum number of data in megabytes to buffer

options.name: SMBServerIdleTimeout
options.description: The maximum amount of time to keep an idle session open in seconds

options.name: CAINPWFILE
options.description: The local filename to store the hashes in Cain&Abel format

options.name: JOHNPWFILE
options.description: The prefix to the local filename to store the hashes in John format

options.name: SMB_EXTENDED_SECURITY
options.description: Use smb extended security negotiation, when set client will use ntlmssp, if not then client will use classic lanman authentification

options.name: NTLM_UseNTLM2_session
options.description: Activate the 'negotiate NTLM2 key' flag in NTLM authentication. When SMB_EXTENDED_SECURITY negotiate is set, client will use ntlm2_session instead of ntlmv1 (default on win 2K and above)

options.name: USE_GSS_NEGOTIATION
options.description: Send a gss_security blob in smb_negotiate response when SMB extended security is set. When this flag is not set, Windows will respond without gss encapsulation, Ubuntu will still use gss.

options.name: DOMAIN_NAME
options.description: The domain name used during smb exchange with SMB_EXTENDED_SECURITY set.
